description: short of length ball on the off stump, batsman pulls on the front-foot and gets the inside edge onto the stumps

What a catch! Dilshan takes a beauty at backward point. Or does he? Taylor is squared-up pushing forward in defence at a delivery slanted away from him. The ball flies off the outer edge and to left of Dilshan who dives to low to his left, scoops up the ball on his left-hand,. it bobs up and Dilshan, now lying on his back, grabs it off the second attempt. Umpires have a chat and give it out.   Replays tell a different story. When the ball bobbed up from the left palm, it touched the grass when Dilshan tried to grab it! Hmm........  The umpires didn't refer it upstairs and that's that

Taylor is stitched up by Vaas. After harassing him with deliveries angling away, he brings this one back in. Taylor is surprised,  and is caught at the crease, the ball thuds into the pad, right in front of the middle stump. Dead duck! Sri Lanka are running hot here. That 263 looks a long distance away

and he strikes first ball! A good length-quick delivery angled across him outside off stump, and Taylor obliges with a flashy drive that takes the regulation outside edge into a diving Gilchrist's gloves, good breakthrough to end a good innings
gone! Anderson has three! Short, rising on Taylor who tries to pull it, but it rushes on him and he skies it to Michael Vaughan at cover

Clark gets another! Pitches short of a length on off stump, Taylor throws his bat at it and tries to heave it down the ground, he gets a lot of height on it but not the distance, Hussey back-pedals from mid-off and takes a well-judged catch

Panesar strikes! Good take at slip, snapped to his right, with Taylor trying to stroke that through cover, reaching for the ball. Monty's the fourth England bowler to take a wicket in his first over and there's a mire with New Zealand's name on it

bowled him round his legs! Clarke angles that down leg side from round teh wicket, Taylor moves well across his stumps and tries to sweep, the ball pitches on leg stump and straightens, Taylor misses the sweep and has his stumps re-arranged!

good bowling from Collingwood, the slower ball, a legcutter and Taylor sails that up to long-on (his hand coming off the bat) where it's Panesar... and can he... oh, Monty makes that catch look easy! Ah, it was. Nevermind, he's cool in collecting it and cool in celebrating - pointing a finger up in the air, as if to say who da man
bowled him! Clarke bowls that fast and a fraction shorter on off stump, Taylor makes a little bit of room and tries to play the slog sweep, he misses and Clarke hits
it's all over for Taylor! slower ball, a little wide, Taylor tries to despatch it over long-on, gets the top edge and hits it down Hussey's throat at midwicket
caught and bowled! Taylor is deceived by the slower one, his feet go nowhere and he offers an easy catch back to Bracken, who gleefully laps it up
what a catch! Flintoff, diving athletically at wide first slip, takes a terrific catch, one handed with his right hand
he's gone this time - a soft pop back up to the bowler, snapped low, who doesn't even celebrate

Stunner from Sangakkara. Full in length, landed on the off and middle and slanted away. Taylor has a stab at it, gets a outside edge and it flies low to the right of Sangakkara who dived full-length and plucked it inches off the turf. Fab effort. Double strike from Vaas has NZ reeling. What a start for SL.

gone! Nel steams in, fires one in one a good length outside off stump, the ball jags in sharply, catching Taylor on the crease, and without any hesitation umpire Benson flashes up the finger...but oh ho, replays show the ball was going well over the stumps...

McGrath gets a wicket off his first ball. Wicket no 66 for him in World cups. Banged in short, Taylor is on the front foot, goes for a pull from there and hits straight to midwicket. McGrath is obviously happy. Looks at the batsman, claps before running away towards the catcher.

Hook, line and sinker! Taylor hasn't had the best time out in the middle and he's adjudged lbw by Taufel this time. Vaas get it at a good length and Taylor comes forward trying to whack it across the line. Misses the ball and is struck on the pads, not much deviation after pitching and the ball might have gone on to miss off but Taufel gives it out. Taylor's forgettable stay comes to an end, Vaas's accuracy is awarded with a wicket. Another debatable decision. The umpires have really struggled on the day
simple catch! Taylor advances to a short delivery and swings out to Nel, well positioned out at deep midwicket, who holds it with utmost ease

played on... it wasn't a particularly good ball.... Nel gives Taylor width outside off to cut, he doesn't move his feet or cover the line and bounce and ends up getting a thick inside edge onto his stumps
Lee strikes! Its full, Taylor comes forward, looking to go on-side, but gets a leading edge that Tait comfortably holds onto at mid-off, and a good innings comes to an end
a swing and a miss, trying to hit through the line, but the ball was too quick and nipped back in trapping him in front of his stumps
trying to sweep once too often and misses the line and is in the line of the stumps and is out

oh dear ... salt in the wound. First the six is discounted and three balls later Taylor misses a straight one and is given lbw. He was a long way forward but it wasn't high.  In normal circumstances that would be okay, but given what has already happened this over, it's bound to be a discussion point ...
redemption for Anderson, and a vital life-line for England. Outside off, hard-handed swish, clear edge, simple catch. Well bowled, and a window of opportunity

gone...and Wright gets the key wicket in rather strange style, Taylor just chipping a catch straight down to Sidebottom at long-on, it was barely a push from Taylor but he timed it so well, too well in fact, and it was a simple catch

a low full toss on the stumps, Taylor slogs again but he doesn't get enough of it and finds the man at deep midwicket. England must have known that was coming, the way Taylor was slogging everything in the last over or so
good delivery here from Broad removes the dangerous Taylor, sneaking through the defences as Taylor looked to play it from outside off, and the full ball nips back and knocks back off stump

oh dear. A super catch from Broad but a wretched shot from Taylor, trying to whack Sidebottom into the deep midwicket stand but he's beaten by pace and can only sky it. Broad, at mid-on, steadies himself to take a comfortable catch
gone! he deserved that, probing line outside off stump and a rather limp push from Taylor sends a regulation edge through to Ambrose
three down now, good ball from Shahadat, Taylor stops his shot and chips the ball in the air straight to Ashraful at mid-off.
short and wide, cut straight to Siddique at backward point
fultoss does the trick - Taylor tries to swing it away on the leg side and ends up with a top edge, Rahim nicely settles under it
flighted up and a touch slower Taylor slices right underneath it and he knows as soon as he hits the ball he's in trouble. The ball soars high and straight in to the hands of the fielder at mid-off
big heave again from Taylor as he backs away and he misses totally as that crashes into off stump

a fabulous catch by Clarke and we have a twist in the tale here, Bracken pitches it up outside off, he walks across his stumps, reaches forward and slices it on the up to backward point, Clarke flings himself to his left and cups it with both hands

momentary loss in concentration and Taylor pays the price!! Short outside off and he slashes at it blindly, played away from his body, gets a thin edge and Haddin makes no mistake. There was no need for that shot, and it's cost him his wicket.

he's given him! Good length on middle, and held its line this time. Taylor came forward to defend, missed it completely and was struck in line. Correct decision there, Taylor showed his bat to the umpire immediately upon being struck on the pads, but Bucknor is having none of the nonsense

gone! Full-toss on the off stump. Taylor, moves across and looks to get cheeky as he wants to paddle it to fine-leg but the ball comes in faster than he expects. Taylor, manages to get a top edge which flies high. Haddin is calling for it right from the moment it flew and takes the catch

he's gifted his wicket here after a superb shot the previous ball! Good length outside off, tries to swat it over the bowler's head, gets the top-edge and Hussey at cover takes a well-judged catch as it takes forever to come down

gone! Tossed up on middle and leg, gets down on one knee and tries to sweep it away behind square, gets the top edge and the ball lobs up to Tendulkar at short fine where it pouches it comfortably. India are chipping away here, and the asking rate has climbed to almost 9
What a gift. Ross Taylor what have you done here? It was short and on the leg side, waiting to be dispatched to the crowd but he mistimes his pull and finds deep backward square leg.

three down! Kulasekara picks up another one! good length delivery, the one that nips back in. Taylor stays back and tries to flick it away on the leg side but fails to make contact and the ball crashes into the pad. Umpire Ashoka de Silva had no hesitation whatsoever

NZ continue to wobble here. Taylor has been nicked out. It landed short of length and left Taylor who pushed at it; he did try to withdraw his bat at the last minute but it was too late by then. Edge and gone. Dhoni lunged to his right to collect that.

Parnell's knack of taking late wicket continues, this time it's the big one of Taylor, who misses a low full toss to be struck in front of middle and off, the umpire took his time before lifting his finger, the replay shows the ball would have crashed into leg stump

Boy o Boy, Sri Lanka are roaring back into the game. Triple strike. It was floated outside off stump, he leans forward to push hard at it and it balloons off the outer edge off the shoulder of the bat to backward point. Gone! Wobble time for NZ.

what a catch! England are fighting back, albeit a little too late, short of a good length outside off, moved away just a hint as he tried to defend off the back foot, got a thick edge and Swann, at second slip, dived full length to his right to take that with one hand inches from the ground
Afridi has done the trick, the new ball works, Taylor is bowled, he was looking to cut that delivery, thinking it would turn, but it went straight on and hits the stumps, big wicket for Pakistan

gone! Bowled it on a good length outside off, gets to the pitch to drive it past point but ends up slicing it just wide of him, Hussey flings himself to his right and takes it over his head, excellent effort

the thickest of edges and he's gone! He fires it in outside off and angles it across the right-hander, Taylor chases it and shapes to carve it over extra cover but he gets a thick edge which thuds into Kamran's gloves
Afridi the rock star strikes. The slider does the trick. It was outside off stump, skidded on straight almost, Taylor pushed outside the line and stabbed it on to the stumps
trapped in front! Spun in sharply from a good length on the off stump, got forward and tried to turn it away towards midwicket, missed and was caught in line. Would have clipped leg stump
Taylor gives it away by slog sweeping firmly but straight out to deep forward square leg where Mahmudullah takes a good diving catch
fullish ball on middle stump and Taylor whips it high into the outfield at square leg where Mahmudullah takes the catch.
Taylor uses his feet again but Shakib beats him with flight and turn as he tries to play through the leg side and Mushfiq has ample time to take the bails off. Vital wicket for Bangladesh!
Watson goes short and hurries Taylor for room and he pulls the ball high on the bat out to mid wicket where Hussey moves around safely to complete the catch. Great break through for Australia

bumper from Watson and Taylor takes the bait, pulling off the top edge out to Hussey on the square leg fence, he moves forward and takes the catch low down. Watson has a real knack of taking wickets at crucial times and there's another. Advantage Australia. Taylor absolutely furious with himself
full on leg stick and Taylor clips it from the middle of the bat out to deep square leg where Hussey moves quickly and takes a good diving catch low down

bumper from Watson outside off and Talylor pulls it high into the leg side and Bollinger moves around from fine leg to take an easy catch in the deep. Watson, once again, makes the important breakthrough

Out five short of 100. He played a fab knock but he is gone now. It was the full-length delivery  that straightened on the middle-stump line and he tried to work it across the line and missed it completely. Trapped! He has done the hard work and has put NZ in a strong position. Can the lower order push them on ahead?

Dead plumb! That tendency to push that front leg across has done him in. It was a length delivery that moved in towards the middle stump. Taylor, as he often does, pushed the front leg across and then tried to get the bat around the front pad. Too late. Trapped!

four, four, and gone! PK comes back superbly. Outswinger gets the edge. Close to off, just short of driving length, Taylor hangs the bat, ball takes a healthy edge, and Dhoni dives in front of first slip to take the catch
plumb! Taylor does his usual shuffle across the stumps to filck to leg, but misses. New Zealand in serious danger of going down here
goodness me! Filthy long hop first up from Shuvo, Taylor rocks back and hoicks it straight down deep square leg's throat! Two key men gone within the first Powerplay for New Zealand

brilliant from Razzak! Around the wicket, the arm ball going straight on, Taylor plays for the non-existent turn and leaves a huge gap between bat and pad. The ball is only too happy to take advantage and crash into the off stump. New Zealand staggering like a drunkard here

And he is gone now, trying to repeat the shot. But this was not the off break but the carrom ball. He went for the big swing to the on side -one of his fav hits -but top edges it straight up. And NZ hurtle towards a big defeat

and he strikes immediately, pitched up and out comes the slog-sweep, it's clubbed hard but straight into the hands of deep midwicket where Kohli takes it comfortably, that dropped chance didn't really cost much in the end

gone! Big appeal, and it's upheld. Lands on a good length and Taylor, quote subdued until now, decides to expand, trying to drive it on the up through the covers, gets a faint inside edge straight to Saha, no doubts about that one, Zaheer has struck again

plumb lbw first ball! A nothing shot really! Moves too far across, and also seems to have told himself to not play the forceful shot first ball. And the bat face closes too early, missing the ball, and he is caught dead in plumb. Tame end to what was shaping up to be an important innings of struggle followed by flourish

and another one goes! Taylor went for the pull to a surprise short delivery that climbed high over him, and got it off the glove for Parthiv to take another easy catch, now Nehra has 150 wickets for India, he is shaking his head as he walks back, Ross

Younis takes a neat catch at first slip. It was a probing delivery that landed on a good length outside off and straightened. Rosco got forward to defend and ended up stabbing it to left of Younis who lunges low to pouch it.

three wickets in three overs, New Zealand are disintegrating. And like the previous two, this is another wicket gifted away. Riaz explores a fuller length, lands it enticingly for the drive outside off and Taylor takes him on, attempting the big booming cover drive. He was so eager to get four, he did not get across enough and just threw his hands at it. The result was a thick outside edge that flew to Younis at slip.

Captain gets captain. Finally an lbw goes Pakistan's way. Afridi slowed this one up through the air, landed it on middle and off. Taylor set himself up for the big booming slog sweep and missed. It did not look as plumb as the previous one, but umpire David upheld this after a good look. Afridi puts his hands up, he wanted that one. Taylor has a smile of resignation as he heads back. Replays say it was just clipping the top of off and middle.

got 'em! Razzaq has struck again, gets rid of Taylor this time, it was bowled in the channel outside off on a length, Taylor got sucked in to the drive, ended up playing a feeble one in the end, and the faint outside edge settled low in to Kamran's gloves, Razzaq breaks in to a wide grin, Pakistan's fightback in this game continues
bowled him! Tait fires a full and fast yorker at Taylor, who had no hope once he made the decision to play across the line. He played around the ball and it crashed into off stump.

Bala strikes with a lovely delivery. It was a flighted leg break on a good length around off and middle. Brave delivery. Correct delivery. Rosco goes for the big hit down the ground but the ball turns and he gets the edge. Hansra moved forward from backward point and dived forward to take a good catch. The Rosco show is over.

Murali is eating away at the NZ line up. Given lbw, but Taylor has refered it. Looked plumb. Did it land outside leg? The mat is awaited. Offie lands around leg stump, the mat is in, and the ball lands just inside the mat and the offie straightens enough to hit middle. Taylor was prodding forward, but he wasn't 2.5 m ahead. Gone. Murali on two legs is lethal. Murali, one on leg with a strained hammie seems to be even more lethal.

big moment. Huge moment. The moment that could turn this match. Tahir has been hustling through his overs, in an attempt to catch Taylor out of breath, before this ball Taylor stopped him by walking down the pitch for some gardening. However, he has perished off the next ball, going for another one of those whip-lashed slog sweeps. It was flighted on leg stump, very full and hence not quite offering him the room to get under it. Taylor ended up launching it high over deep square leg, and when it came down, the greatest allrounder in the game was under it.

Taylor's struggle ends. You felt something was coming. In the end it's a poor delivery, dragged short that Taylor pulled straight down the throat of deep midwicket. Normally you'd back Taylor to clear that boundary but he's not quite found his range today

Taylor is bowled, which also means KW won't get a hundred. Back to Taylor, though. It's a lenght ball, the kind he sometimes hits for sixes blindfolded. But he misses this, and the middle stump goes for a walk

what a way to get out, Samuels spears it in full at 110 kph, insanely quick, Taylor walks outside the crease as leans forward, the ball hits Taylor's front boot, rolls to the keeper, brushes his glove, hits his pad and rolls into the stumps, Taylor's back foot is still in the air, and Samuels and West Indies get lucky

sharp catch at cover! Kulasekara fired that full outside off and Taylor tried to smoke that past cover, went flat to Mathews who timed his dive well, Mathews showed no emotion after taking it but SL will be relieved they've seen the back of Taylor
wide length ball, Taylor wanted to smash it towards the extra cover region but edges it straight to the keeper. Wild shot there by Taylor
soft end to a promising New Zealand partnership as Woakes' bouncer surprises Taylor and induces a top-edged pull which sails into the big mitts of Finn at fine leg, critical breakthrough for England

Taylor goes and England have recovered well after the McCullum onslaught, short outside off and moved back in a touch, cramped for room as he tried to cut and could only get a thick edge through to Buttler

he's got him, Anderson makes the breakthrough via a thin inside edge! This may have just drifted down the hill slightly, a lenght ball and Taylor was driving away from his body, on the up, the ball scraped a bit of paint off the bat before landing up in Buttler's gloves. A 120-run partnership has made NZ favourites but England have an opening

goes again but this has gone up rather than long and Woakes takes the catch at long leg. That is a fine catch cause it went a long long way up, a top edge from Taylor attempted the same stroke over the leg side

another slog sweep and this time finds the fielder who is Finn again, he falls backwards again but Tim Bresnan is on hand to complete the catch, a good offload from Finn. He took the catch a foot inside the rope, then steadied himself, realised he didn't have the balance and popped the ball up the Bresnan who pocketed it and claims the dismissal!

the finger has gone up! No review this time! Herath has done what Dan Vettori did to Mahela. After flighting a couple of deliveries, he bowls the arm ball and Ross Taylor gets hit in front as he plays down the wrong line, the ball thudding onto his front pad in front of the middle stump. It would have gone on to hit middle and leg. Can Sri Lanka set in some panic in the New Zealand camp?

seaming in and rapped on the pad, Oxenford gives it after a few seconds' thought - but Taylor immediately reviews. He was struck on the back leg, on the thigh as he was coming forward - Hot Spot shows no inside edge ... and the decision stands, Taylor is out! It was in line with off, thudding into the off ball. New Zealand are three down and they've lost their review

good length ball pitching on the middle stump and moving away. Taylor is looking to steer it and gets an outside edge. Rahim accepts it with glee as he knows that Taylor can take the game away from them quickly. Rubel, like Mahmudullah and Gazi strikes early
no, he isn't ! Gazi flights the ball outside the off stump. Taylor lofts it straight into the hands of Mahmudullah at long-on.

Taylor's not hit it as well as Ryder has been! He slogged it from wide outside off stump and ended up mis-hitting it towards wide long-on, where Powell took the catch. He was hitting that against the turn

gets this one to turn away on off as Taylor seems to have edged this behind to the keeper. Umpire straightaway gives it out, but Taylor shakes his head, not convinced, and goes for the review straightaway. Looks like there is nothing on HotSpot either. But snicko does show that there was a deflection off the edge, so this may very well be upheld. New Zealand four down and with still about 40 overs to go, and over 300 more to get

and Shami strikes straight away as he gets Taylor to play a tired shot, having a go at this one wide outside off which catches the outside edge on the way to Dhoni, who does well to snaffle it. Ends a fighting knock from Taylor

caught behind, Shami's bowling a clever over after Ishant's disastrous one. He bowled a slower short ball and got good height on it too. Taylor pulled far too early and got a top edge that carried through to Dhoni

and finally India hold on to a catch. Dhawan at deep midwicket does a very good job as he picks up a skier. Slower ball outside off stump as he goes down on one knee and looks for that slog sweep again. He's mis-hit it though and Dhawan moves to his left and dives to pick up a good catch.

Sohail strikes, his maiden wicket in ODIs! What a big one this is! It was not short enough but Taylor went for the cut nonetheless, he underedges it to the keeper. Taylor was looking like he was about to walk, but he waited an extra second.. the umpire took his time and finally sent him on his way
that was expected, the double S - Shahid Slider! This keep's sliding in and Taylor doesn't really have the space, or the right length, to cut it.. It sneaks in and flattens the middle stump.
nicks off! No feet from Taylor as he threw his hands at a fuller delivery outside off and the outside edge is fine enough for the wicketkeeper to control it

...but that doesn't matter. Herath gets him next ball. He goes for the sweep again, is hurried into the shot by the pace of the ball, and top-edges it high in the air, and Perera settles under it comfortably at short fine leg

two in two overs for Mathews! But Taylor's reviewed it straight away. He had moved across to a good length ball on middle and leg, quite a long way actually, and has been rapped in front of middle. On the knee-roll. HotSpot shows no edge either. Looks like New Zealand are headed towards a lost review. And yep, the ball tracker said it would clip leg stump and sides with umpire's call

Herath has taken a big scalp here as Taylor's struggle at the crease is brought to an end. Slides this one just outside off as Taylor gets an under-edge which Sangakkara is able to collect cleanly from behind. Taylor doesn't offer any resistance as he storms away from the crease

unbelievable. Thirimanne has done it! Who would have thunk it? Taylor takes this fullish length wide of off and ends up slogging it over to the midwicket fielder, who just can't believe his luck as he takes a simple catch in the deep

tossed up on middle and leg as Taylor is late on this, looking to tickle this behind through fine leg. Dilshan likes it, and the umpire acquiesces, but Taylor wants a review. Struck him on the toe with nothing on HotSpot either. It is all red so Taylor has to go, and unfortunately for him, he falls just 4 short of his century. Joins Williamson as the other 90-er in the innings

what a beauty to get this over away after the break as he tosses one up on middle which turns away from Ross, who is late on it as Sangakkara moves experly behind to complete the take and remove the bails just before Ross is able to get his foot back on the line, so this looks like it is out. Ruled not out by the umpire initially, so the umpire wants to have a closer look. Replays look as though he might be just out before both the bails were dislodged, as it looks like presently only one of the bails were removed before Taylor got his foot back across the line. This really is touch and go. The verdict has come in and he is out

slides this one through the gate of Taylor as he advanced down the track. Beats him in the flight as he brought down the blade, with Ronchi alert to the situation as he whipped off the bails. Scotland sensing the end here as they slide further to 136 for 8

knocks him over, there goes the off stump! Taylor tried a cross-batted shot for the length delivery just around off, the ball swung in and went right through the gate to rattle the off stump. The players head off for what was supposed to be innings break at this time

Ross looking to slog-sweep this over cow corner as he is struck in front of middle and leg. Looked as plumb as they get, with Ross initially walking off before Corey intervened. Ross decides to go for the review. Quite a waste of a review DRS confirms this indeed was going on to hit timber. The only thing now is NZ are down a review as they enter this crucial period of the match. May come back to hurt them later...

oh he has produced the massive wicket. South Africa have brought all the luck today. This is a soft dismissal. The second in a row. Fires this offbreak into the pads, Taylor looks to shuffle across and work this to leg, but he has moved too far across, and has edged it to de Kock, who takes a superb catch. Looking at that catch, there is no luck involved there. This is brilliant because the deflection is big

slower ball first up, and they have appealed for a catch at the wicket. Dharmasena has gone to the third umpire with no soft signal this time. This is a slower legcutter, nearly a yorker, really really full. Taylor looks to drive, and the ball lobs to Haddin's right. The umpires check on both counts: bump ball and a clean catch. Replays show the ball has pitched just before hitting Taylor's bat, takes the outside edge, and the edge is soft, dying to Haddin's right. He flies to his right, takes a stunning one-handed catch. This is a huge wicket. Clutch players strike first ball in the Powerplay

full and straight again, Taylor plays across the line, misses... and this time Finn's appeal succeeds! Taylor review, which he has to as the last recognised batsman, but loses a tight call on the DRS, with Hawk-Eye saying it would have just clipped leg. So England get the man they wanted, NZ seven down now and in need of miracles (plural)

another one goes! An ugly end to Taylor's innings. He has a heave across the line and gets an inside edge into his stumps. Just having a quick check of this, in case anything else knocked off the bails, but the ball was straight into off stump

full and straight, Taylor tries to heave it over long-on... but is smacked flush on the pads, that is gone! That was a cutter from Finn, slightly slower and it gripped a fraction, beat Taylor's big ole swing and pinned him on the back leg in front of middle and off - easy decision for Rob Bailey
No fifty for Taylor. He edges it behind. Full and cuts away outside off, Taylor pushes with firm hands and feeds an outside edge. Bairstow dives across to his right and takes a smart catch

got him this time, caught at slip, Taylor has gone for a duck! There was a bit of flight, it was just outside off and Taylor decided to go back this time to push it into the off side but the ball spun away marginally and took the outside edge to head to Mathews at slip who grabbed it with both hands

gone. Taylor slog-sweeps but straight to deep square leg. Another slower ball on middle, Taylor goes for the swipe but like many before him, Taylor fails to connect as well as he would have liked. Big wicket

got 'im first ball. What a jaffa from Umesh Yadav. On a good length outside off, the ball moves away just enough, like it has been doing all afternoon. Taylor sees the length, thinks he can lay bat on ball but the out swing takes the edge of his prodding bat. Not much can be done about that to be fair. India's seamers on point so far, extracting just enough away movement

caught on the slog-swipe at deep midwicket. Taylor has fallen to the plan. Mishra bowled the ball faster and outside off stump, Taylor met it with a lunge on the front foot and dragged it from outside off, he hit it quite a long way but not long enough to clear Rohit Sharma on the edge of the boundary

absolute beauty! It was slow. It was tossed up. It was drifting in. And it dips too. Poor Taylor, he was suckered into coming forward, suckered into flicking agains the turn, which dances past the leading edge, through to Dhoni who completes the stumping. Dream delivery for a legspinner

he's walking. Goes for a cut shot, but Mishra gets a little more bounce than Taylor expects. Only the smallest mistake. But that's all you get sometimes. The umpires check if the no-ball. it is tight, but Mishra's fine and he can celebrate a beautifully crafted wicket. Great work from Dhoni too. One of the best keepers to spin

too full for the sweep and Taylor drags it back onto the stumps. Tossed up and angling across off, wide outside off, Taylor goes low and makes a mess of the sweep. Head reaps reward for some tight bowling

pummels it... straight to deep square leg. Taylor walks off to a rousing ovation, but without him, New Zealand have no hope of getting to the kind of score they want. Good bowling from Faulkner, hitting a stump-to-stump line, changing his pace as often as possible

chipped back to Morris! It hasn't been the easiest surfaces to drive on the up. Full delivery on off, Taylor drives - the length was there to hit it - but he just hits the ball back to Morris, who holds on with both hands. Very good catch

pins him! It's Pretorius' turn to take out an NZ lynch pin. Taylor plays across the line of a full and straight delivery. He misses, the ball strikes pad, low and in front of middle stump. No surprise the umpire's finger shot up

and as soon as the fielder comes in, he has fallen for it. Comes down the track to this full toss and it is dipping. He tries to loft it over mid-on as he sees the fielder coming in but with the ball dipping on him, cannot make good connection. Ends up chipping a straightforward catch to the fielder there

oh dear. Awful shot. Just awful from a senior batsman at 51 for 3. Good length, angled in at off stump and Phehlukwayo has suckered another one in to playing across the line and look for the midwicket boundary. This should be crashing into off-and-middle at a reasonable height.

what has Taylor done here? Its a delivery outside off-stump and Taylor looks to play the ball down to third man again. It bounces a bit more then he expects and pops up in the air, Porterfield runs in from point and takes a simple catch.
Taylor is still trying to play the ball into the legside, its full and straight from Mustafizur and hits him on the pads. It's in front of the stumps and its out.
what a horrible ball to get out too! McCarthy tries for the yorker and it ends up as a full toss. Hits the ball high to the square leg boundary, its straight to Singh and he takes an simple catch
there's the wicket! A cross-seam delivery, pace off the ball, Taylor climbs into an ambitious yahoo, but that is a spiralling top-edge, easily pocketed in the covers

tries to slog off a length... but picks out midwicket! Taylor's pips squeak as England squeeze out another big wicket. Tight lines paying off for Ball, a solid grab from Root with Taylor trying to manufacture something

good adjustment from Taskin. Taylor goes for a premeditated ramp over fine leg, but he's shuffled across too early. Taskin sees him and digs this back of a length. He makes it a legcutter too. Taylor completely done for timing and is in a pretty poor position. Can only offer this to short fine
Chahal is claiming the catch at extra cover and Taylor is gone for 95! He's played a splendid hand, but it ends with a wide half-volley being smacked to the fielder, low to his right.

he's walking. Pandya leaps for joy as he bounces out one of New Zealand's kingpins. Taylor goes for the hook, but only feathers the ball, originally aimlessly wandering down leg, into Dhoni's waiting hands.

Outside edge, and taken! Slower ball, an offcutter to be accurate, and Taylor was too early through with his defense off the front foot. It hits the shoulder of his bat, and lobs up to Jadhav at point. There's the breakthrough
what a great catch! Good length just outside off and Taylor chooses to poke at it, takes the outside edge and Shai Hope dives to his right. Taylor goes after another useful fifty

sharp nip off the surface! Good length outside off but angling into the right hander, moves sharply into Taylor's body and he's beaten for pace. Off stump is dislodged and Taylor has to make his way back

flat and straight and given! Short on middle, Taylor opts not to review. That's halfway up, in front of middle. Only question for the umpire was if it pitched in line. Taylor stayed low but missed a pull off a straight delivery. This being the 43rd over, he could have taken a risk. But walks right off. A fine fifty from Taylor.

a failure for Taylor in his 200th ODI. Walks across and pays the price for playing against the line. Tries to flick but the length ball cuts into him and hits him dead in front of middle and leg. Game on in Hamilton

paddles it onto the stumps. Full ball dipping in at off stump. Gets low to try and run this past short fine with a ramp but he ends up getting beside the ball and getting it off the inside half of the bat, into middle stump

dragged down the track and stumped by a mile! Beautiful flight and bite from Rashid, that's the impact the leggie can have at the death. Taylor wanted to keep the hammer down, but that was a wicket-taking delivery that demanded more respect, Buttler gathered way outside off to whip off the bails, and it's an ignominious end to a very very fine innings!
